dom-devicemotionevent-devicemotionevent.name: DeviceMotionEvent
dom-devicemotionevent-devicemotionevent.summary: The DeviceMotionEvent() constructor creates a new DeviceMotionEvent.
dom-devicemotionevent-devicemotionevent.title: DeviceMotionEvent()

ref-for-dom-devicemotionevent-accelerati.name: acceleration
ref-for-dom-devicemotionevent-accelerati.summary: The acceleration property returns the amount of acceleration recorded by the device, in meters per second squared (m/s²).
ref-for-dom-devicemotionevent-accelerati.title: DeviceMotionEvent.acceleration

ref-for-dom-devicemotionevent-accelerati.name: accelerationIncludingGravity
ref-for-dom-devicemotionevent-accelerati.summary: The accelerationIncludingGravity property returns the amount of acceleration recorded by the device, in meters per second squared (m/s²). Unlike DeviceMotionEvent.acceleration which compensates for the influence of gravity, its value is the sum of the acceleration of the device as induced by the user and the acceleration caused by gravity.
ref-for-dom-devicemotionevent-accelerati.title: DeviceMotionEvent.accelerationIncludingGravity

ref-for-dom-devicemotionevent-interval①.name: interval
ref-for-dom-devicemotionevent-interval①.summary: Returns the interval, in milliseconds, at which data is obtained from the underlying hardware. You can use this to determine the granularity of motion events.
ref-for-dom-devicemotionevent-interval①.title: DeviceMotionEvent.interval

ref-for-dom-devicemotionevent-rotationra.name: rotationRate
ref-for-dom-devicemotionevent-rotationra.summary: Returns the rate at which the device is rotating around each of its axes in degrees per second.
ref-for-dom-devicemotionevent-rotationra.title: DeviceMotionEvent.rotationRate

devicemotion.name: DeviceMotionEvent
devicemotion.summary: The DeviceMotionEvent provides web developers with information about the speed of changes for the device's position and orientation.
devicemotion.title: DeviceMotionEvent

devicemotion.name: devicemotion_event
devicemotion.summary: The devicemotion event is fired at a regular interval and indicates the amount of physical force of acceleration the device is receiving at that time. It also provides information about the rate of rotation, if available.
devicemotion.title: Window: devicemotion event

dom-devicemotioneventacceleration-x.name: x
dom-devicemotioneventacceleration-x.summary: This read-only property indicates the amount of acceleration that occurred along the X axis in a DeviceMotionEventAcceleration object.
dom-devicemotioneventacceleration-x.title: DeviceMotionEventAcceleration: x

dom-devicemotioneventacceleration-y.name: y
dom-devicemotioneventacceleration-y.summary: This read-only property indicates the amount of acceleration that occurred along the Y axis in a DeviceMotionEventAcceleration object.
dom-devicemotioneventacceleration-y.title: DeviceMotionEventAcceleration: y

dom-devicemotioneventacceleration-z.name: z
dom-devicemotioneventacceleration-z.summary: This read-only property indicates the amount of acceleration that occurred along the Z axis in a DeviceMotionEventAcceleration object.
dom-devicemotioneventacceleration-z.title: DeviceMotionEventAcceleration: z

devicemotioneventacceleration.name: DeviceMotionEventAcceleration
devicemotioneventacceleration.summary: A DeviceMotionEventAcceleration object provides information about the amount of acceleration the device is experiencing along all three axes.
devicemotioneventacceleration.title: DeviceMotionEventAcceleration

dom-devicemotioneventrotationrate-alpha.name: alpha
dom-devicemotioneventrotationrate-alpha.summary: This property indicates the rate of rotation around the Z axis -- in degrees per second -- in a DeviceMotionEventRotationRate object.
dom-devicemotioneventrotationrate-alpha.title: DeviceMotionEventRotationRate: alpha

dom-devicemotioneventrotationrate-beta.name: beta
dom-devicemotioneventrotationrate-beta.summary: This property indicates the rate of rotation around the X axis -- in degrees per second -- in a DeviceMotionEventRotationRate object.
dom-devicemotioneventrotationrate-beta.title: DeviceMotionEventRotationRate: beta

dom-devicemotioneventrotationrate-gamma.name: gamma
dom-devicemotioneventrotationrate-gamma.summary: This property indicates the rate of rotation around the Y axis -- in degrees per second -- in a DeviceMotionEventRotationRate object.
dom-devicemotioneventrotationrate-gamma.title: DeviceMotionEventRotationRate: gamma

devicemotioneventrotationrate.name: DeviceMotionEventRotationRate
devicemotioneventrotationrate.summary: A DeviceMotionEventRotationRate object provides information about the rate at which the device is rotating around all three axes.
devicemotioneventrotationrate.title: DeviceMotionEventRotationRate

dom-deviceorientationevent-deviceorienta.name: DeviceOrientationEvent
dom-deviceorientationevent-deviceorienta.summary: The DeviceOrientationEvent() constructor creates a new DeviceOrientationEvent.
dom-deviceorientationevent-deviceorienta.title: DeviceOrientationEvent()

ref-for-dom-deviceorientationevent-absol.name: absolute
ref-for-dom-deviceorientationevent-absol.summary: Indicates whether or not the device is providing orientation data absolutely (that is, in reference to the Earth's coordinate frame) or using some arbitrary frame determined by the device. See Orientation and motion data explained for details.
ref-for-dom-deviceorientationevent-absol.title: DeviceOrientationEvent.absolute

ref-for-dom-deviceorientationevent-alpha.name: alpha
ref-for-dom-deviceorientationevent-alpha.summary: Returns the rotation of the device around the Z axis; that is, the number of degrees by which the device is being twisted around the center of the screen. See Orientation and motion data explained for details.
ref-for-dom-deviceorientationevent-alpha.title: DeviceOrientationEvent.alpha

ref-for-dom-deviceorientationevent-beta②.name: beta
ref-for-dom-deviceorientationevent-beta②.summary: Returns the rotation of the device around the X axis; that is, the number of degrees, ranged between -180 and 180, by which the device is tipped forward or backward. See Orientation and motion data explained for details.
ref-for-dom-deviceorientationevent-beta②.title: DeviceOrientationEvent.beta

ref-for-dom-deviceorientationevent-gamma.name: gamma
ref-for-dom-deviceorientationevent-gamma.summary: Returns the rotation of the device around the Y axis; that is, the number of degrees, ranged between -90 and 90, by which the device is tilted left or right. See Orientation and motion data explained for details.
ref-for-dom-deviceorientationevent-gamma.title: DeviceOrientationEvent.gamma

deviceorientation.name: DeviceOrientationEvent
deviceorientation.summary: The DeviceOrientationEvent provides web developers with information from the physical orientation of the device running the web page.

chrome.notes: Before version 50, Chrome provided absolute values instead of relative values for this event. Developers still needing absolute values may use the ondeviceorientationabsolute event.

chrome_android.notes: Before version 50, Chrome provided absolute values instead of relative values for this event. Developers still needing absolute values may use the ondeviceorientationabsolute event.

firefox.notes: Firefox 3.6, 4, and 5 supported mozOrientation instead of the standard DeviceOrientationEvent interface.

firefox_android.notes: Firefox 3.6, 4, and 5 supported mozOrientation instead of the standard DeviceOrientationEvent interface.

samsunginternet_android.notes: Before Samsung Internet 5.0, Samsung Internet provided absolute values instead of relative values for this event. Developers still needing absolute values may use the ondeviceorientationabsolute event.

webview_android.notes: Before version 50, Chrome provided absolute values instead of relative values for this event. Developers still needing absolute values may use the ondeviceorientationabsolute event.

edge_blink.notes: Before version 50, Chrome provided absolute values instead of relative values for this event. Developers still needing absolute values may use the ondeviceorientationabsolute event.

deviceorientation.title: DeviceOrientationEvent

deviceorientation.name: deviceorientation_event
deviceorientation.summary: The deviceorientation event is fired when fresh data is available from an orientation sensor about the current orientation of the device as compared to the Earth coordinate frame. This data is gathered from a magnetometer inside the device.
deviceorientation.title: Window: deviceorientation event

ref-for-dom-window-ondevicemotion.name: ondevicemotion
ref-for-dom-window-ondevicemotion.summary: An event handler for the devicemotion events sent to the window.
ref-for-dom-window-ondevicemotion.title: Window.ondevicemotion

ref-for-dom-window-ondeviceorientation.name: ondeviceorientation
ref-for-dom-window-ondeviceorientation.summary: An event handler for the deviceorientation event, which contains information about a relative device orientation change.
ref-for-dom-window-ondeviceorientation.title: Window.ondeviceorientation
